answerText: cumulonimbus clouds [10]  Clouds take an anvil shape in these severe, organized thunderstorms that contain a mesocyclone. Tornadoes often develop in these types of storms.
heading: ACF Regionals  |2012 | Michigan A + George Mason | 12 | Science | Other | College
subject: Science
question: Question: For 10 points each, answer the following about thunderstorms: [10] These tall clouds that are often found in thunderstorms can have anvil shaped tops.
